subject: RE: Vendor Details Needed for Invoicing – 9916-JC & 9927-RP

full_threads.body:
Hi Ben,

Sure, confirming novarisupport@ is included to the list of admin notifications.

Hi Joel,


Are you able to add in novarisupport@novaricollective.com to acceptance notification emails?


Thanks


Regards,


Ben Rookes

Operations Manager

Subject: Re: Vendor Details Needed for Invoicing - 9916-JC & 9927-RP


Hi Mikaela,
I haven't been receiving email notifications when a proposal is accepted, which has caused a bit of confusion on my end. However, I've noticed that I can check the status directly in the online proposal, as shown in the image below.
Could you please confirm if this is the correct way to verify acceptance?





Kind regards,

Elaine Santos

From: Mikaela Camilleri <mcamilleri@novaricollective.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 17, 2025 9:30 AM
To: Novari Support <NovariSupport@novaricollective.com>
Subject: RE: Vendor Details Needed for Invoicing - 9916-JC & 9927-RP


Hi Elaine,

When a job/quote is accepted I believe you will receive an email notifying you that the quote has been approved - can you confirm you receive these automatic emails?

If you do, it is only when you receive this email, you can invoice the client *only* if a booking form has been completed and the installation for the job has been put into the calendar.

Let me know if this makes sense. 😊

Mikaela Camilleri

Property Styling &
Interior Design Admin

+61 455 523 940

+61 3 9580 4102

Subject: Re: Vendor Details Needed for Invoicing - 9916-JC & 9927-RP

Noted on this, Mikaela.

I wasn't aware that I needed to check the online proposal to see if it was accepted. Chyrin had mentioned referring to the booking form and the proposal via email, so I was a bit confused.

But thank you-I've now found it and understand the process better.

Really appreciate your help!

Kind regards,

Elaine Santos

Subject: RE: Vendor Details Needed for Invoicing - 9916-JC & 9927-RP

Hi Elaine,

Please only invoice when the quote has been approved.

As this is where you'll find the vendors details. 😊

As both of these jobs haven't been approved, you won't have these details yet.

In the instances where I have asked you to issue an invoice prior to the quote being accepted this is not something we normally do, but depending on the situation/case we may need to do this on the odd occasion to receive the funds for the job earlier.

Mikaela Camilleri
